Name: PCMU
Description: ITU-T G.711 PCM µ-Law Audio 64 kbit/s

Name: reserved (previously G721)
Description: reserved, previously ITU-T G.721 ADPCM Audio 32 kbit/s

Name: GSM
Description: European GSM Full Rate Audio 13 kbit/s (GSM 06.10)

Name: PCMA
Description: ITU-T G.711 PCM A-Law Audio 64 kbit/s

Name: L16
Description: Linear PCM 16-bit Stereo Audio 1411.2 kbit/s, uncompressed

Name: CN
Description: Comfort noise. Payload type used with audio codecs that do not support comfort noise as part of the codec itself such as G.711, G.722.1, G.722, G.726, G.727, G.728, GSM 06.10, Siren, and RTAudio.

Name: iLBC
Description: Internet low Bitrate Codec 13.33 or 15.2 kbit/s

Name: AMR-WB+
Frame size (ms): 80 (super-frame; internally divided in to transport frames of 13.33, 14.22, 15, 16, 17.78, 20, 21.33, 24, 26.67, 30, 35.55, or 40)
Description: Extended Adaptive Multi Rate – WideBand audio

Name: vorbis
Clock rate (Hz): any (must be a multiple of sample rate)
Default packet size (ms): as many Vorbis packets as fit within the path MTU, unless it exceeds an application's desired transmission latency
Description: RTP Payload Format for Vorbis Encoded Audio

Name: opus
Default packet size (ms): 20, minimum allowed value 3 (rounded from 2.5), maximum allowed value 120 (allowed values are 3, 5, 10, 20, 40, or 60 or an arbitrary multiple of Opus frame sizes rounded up to the next full integer value up to a maximum value of 120)
Description: RTP Payload Format for Opus Speech and Audio Codec

Name: speex
Description: RTP Payload Format for the Speex Codec

Name: mpa-robust
Description: A More Loss-Tolerant RTP Payload Format for MP3 Audio

Name: MP4A-LATM
Description: RTP Payload Format for MPEG-4 Audio

Name: MP4V-ES
Description: RTP Payload Format for MPEG-4 Visual

Name: mpeg4-generic
Description: RTP Payload Format for Transport of MPEG-4 Elementary Streams

Name: VP8
Description: RTP Payload Format for Transport of VP8 Streams
